about_the_game:
Rolling Thunder: Vietnam is a squad-based first-person shooter set during the Vietnam War, offering deep tactical gameplay and intense, large scale battles. Work closely with your squad to navigate the chaos of war, utilizing combined arms combat with infantry, armored vehicles, helicopters, boats, and jets in 64 player battles where tactics and teamwork are the keys to victory.

Immersive class based combat

While navigating the lush jungles, treacherous rivers, and war-torn villages of Vietnam, Your squad will be the most important capability you have. You must master the art of coordination with your squad and utilize your class abilities to complement their combat efficiency in the field. 

Player will have access to multiple classes to chose from, such as:

  • Squad Leader

  • Assault

  • Medic

  • Support

  • Engineer

  • Recon

Community and Teamwork

In Rolling Thunder: Vietnam, teamwork and communication are essential to survival on the battlefield, and it's one of the core pillars of its development.

The game will feature in-depth social systems, such as built-in local and squad wide VOIP, party options, and clan support, ensuring you can fight alongside existing friends as well as forge new friendships with the soldier in the foxhole next to you.

Combined arms and logistics 

The game will feature complete combined arms, including but not limited to:

  • Jeeps

  • Tanks

  • Armored personnel carriers 

  • Patrol boats

  • Transport and Attack helicopters

  • Jets and other aircraft

All of these assets will be at the hands of you as a player, and you will need to use these efficiently to defeat the enemy. 

You will also be able to build an assortment of field fortifications using supplies transported from your base, and managing these vital logistics is key to keep the team in the fight. Whether you're dropping into a hot LZ from a helicopter or supporting your team with artillery support from the rear lines, every role matters in the fight for victory.

Welcome to the jungle, Soldier.
